content: copy cat copy cat hat this is an 8 ply version of the copy cat c c beanie on ravelry with a couple of my own modifications this is a simple beanie that can be worn pulled down over the ears or pushed back a bit to be a little slouchy using dk / 8 ply yarn it is knitted in the round from the brim upwards using circular needles and magic-loop alternatively it could be knit with double-pointed needles materials & equipment 50 - 100g of dk / 8 ply yarn depending on size circular needles - 4 0mm or a set of double-pointed needles 1 stitch marker darning needle tape measure gauge 22 sts/10cm on 4 0mm needles in stocking stitch in the round page 1 of 3 ©heathermaid designs 2018 version 2 sizing the large size will fit an average to large adult the small size will fit a child or small adult head the very small size will fit a baby you can knit anything in between just cast on an even number of stitches and adjust the depth of the hat accordingly by knitting less repeats or do less purl rounds in each repeat abbreviations k - knit p - purl k2tog - knit two stitches together st - stitch instructions brim if a tighter brim is required use 3 75 mm needles for the brim only using 4 mm needles and a stretchy cast on method cast on 108 for the large size 100 for the small and 74 for a baby size join for working in the round and place a stitch marker to indicate start of the round work k1 p1 ribbing for 15 large 12 small 10 baby row - or for a turned up brim - work double the number of rounds body repeat the following step 4 times choosing the size you are working on large knit 2 rounds purl 6 rounds knit 2 rounds work k1 p1 rib for 2 rounds small knit 2 rounds purl 5 rounds knit 2 rounds work k1 p1 rib for 2 rounds baby knit 1 round purl 4 rounds knit 2 rounds work k1 p1 rib for 2 rounds page 2 of 3 ©heathermaid designs 2018 version 2 crown follow the instructions for the size you are working on large knit 5 rounds k2tog repeat across the round 54 st knit 2 rounds k2tog repeat across the round 27 st knit 1 round k2tog 13 times k1 14 st k2tog repeat across the round 7 st small knit 5 rounds k2tog repeat across the round 50 st knit 2 rounds k2tog repeat across the round 25 st knit 1 round k2tog 12 times k1 13 st k2tog 6 times k1 7 st baby knit 3 rounds k2tog across the round 37 st knit 1 round k2tog 18 times k1 19 st knit 1 round k2tog 9 times k1 10 st if you find it easier switch to double-pointed needles as the number
